articles.author: SAM MEDNICK and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — A delegation of the Palestinian militant group Hamas was in Cairo on Saturday as Egyptian state media reported “noticeable progress” in ongoing cease-fire talks with Israel while an Israeli official downplayed the prospects for a full end to the war.
articles.title: Egypt media cite progress in truce talks as Israel downplays chances of end to war with Hamas

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — The Ukrainian village of Ocheretyne has been battered by fighting, drone footage obtained by The Associated Press shows. The village has been a target for Russian forces in the Donetsk region of eastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Drone footage shows Ukrainian village battered to ruins as residents flee Russian advance

articles.author: JUAN A. LOZANO and LEKAN OYEKANMI
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — The Houston area was under threat of worsening flood conditions Saturday, a day after heavy storms slammed the region and authorities warned those in low-lying areas to evacuate ahead of an expected “catastrophic” surge of water.
articles.title: Houston braces for flooding to worsen in wake of storms

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM, JILL COLVIN and CALVIN WOODWARD
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Joe Biden and Donald Trump are two presidents with unfinished business and an itch to get it done.
articles.title: Biden and Trump offer worlds-apart contrasts on issues in 2024's rare contest between 2 presidents

articles.author: VALERIE GONZALEZ and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — For two decades, U.S. Rep. Henry Cuellar has stood out as a moderate Democrat along the Texas-Mexico border, bucking his party at times over guns and immigration while seldom facing a tough reelection.
articles.title: Rep. Henry Cuellar of Texas vows to continue his bid for an 11th term despite bribery indictment

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Israel this week briefed Biden administration officials on a plan to evacuate Palestinian civilians ahead of a potential operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah aimed at rooting out Hamas militants, according to U.S.
articles.title: Israel has briefed US on plan to evacuate Palestinian civilians ahead of potential Rafah operation

articles.author: EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) — Israel-Hamas war demonstrations at the University of Mississippi turned ugly this week when one counter-protester appeared to make monkey noises and gestures at a Black student in a raucous gathering that was endorsed by a far-right congressman from Georgia.
articles.title: Congressman praises heckling of war protesters, including 1 who made monkey gestures at Black woman

articles.author: PAN PYLAS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Kevin Spacey, the Oscar-winning actor, has denied new allegations of inappropriate behaviour from men who will feature in a documentary on British television that is due to be released next week.
articles.title: Kevin Spacey denies new allegations of inappropriate behavior to be aired on UK television next week

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: As the U.S. government moves toward reclassifying marijuana as a less dangerous drug, there may be little immediate impact in the dozen states that have not already legalized cannabis for widespread medical or recreational use by adults.
articles.title: Marijuana backers eye proposed federal regulatory change as an aid to legalizing pot in more states

articles.author: EDNA TARIGAN
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — A flood and a landslide hit Indonesia’s Sulawesi island, killing 14 people, officials said Saturday.Torrential rain pounding the area since Thursday triggered a landslide in Luwu district in South Sulawesi province, said local rescue chief Mexianus Bekabel.
articles.title: Flood and landslide hit Indonesia's Sulawesi island, killing 14
